core module¶

class core.CommandLoader(tree, accepted=[])[source]¶

Bases: object

An object that can execute commands. Its member functions match the names of the different commands, and are the functions that are actually called when executing the command.

class core.Commands[source]¶

Bases: list

This object is a list of tuples of strings. The tuples represent single commands, the first element is the user, the second the functions and the rest are the arguments.

classmethod from_raw(data)[source]¶

changes a string of commands to a list of command objects

to_html()[source]¶

changes a list of command object to a html display, used to show the console on the website

to_raw()[source]¶

changes a list of command object to a raw string of commands

get_parther(person, family)[source]¶

give the partner of the person in the given family. If you want all pertners the person even had, use: get_partners(person)

get_partners(person)[source]¶

returns all persons partners

get_person(name)[source]¶

returns a person woth the given name. If there isn’t one, it creates a new one and retusn that one

get_representation(person)[source]¶

Object to represent a part of the family tree. head represents the people on the same line indicated by the given person, they include the person himself and all the partners he ever had tail represents the people on the next line. These contain the children. This one is usually chained, as to give the correct representation, they need the head entry of each child

get_siblings(person)[source]¶

returns all persons siblings and half-siblings

people_all¶

returns a list of people the family tree contains, iven the not yet connected ones

people_linked¶

returns a list of people the family tree contains and are connected

write(person)[source]¶

returns a string representing the posterity of the given person
